title: Securing Critical Infrastructure with Global Hardware Sourcing

client.name: Confidential – Series A Indian Cybersecurity Company
client.description: A fast-growing Indian innovator building next-generation Layer 3 (L3) network attack prevention hardware for enterprise infrastructure.

challenge.summary: The client had developed a breakthrough L3 attack prevention appliance but faced severe supply chain bottlenecks for critical hardware components, risking product launch and enterprise credibility.
details: Key components (specialized SoCs, secure enclaves, networking ICs) sourced only from limited global suppliers (US, Taiwan, Israel).
Lead times exceeded 22 weeks, delaying customer pilots and commercial launch.
No internal procurement team with cross-border sourcing or Indian import compliance expertise.
High risk of supply disruption threatening SLAs with banking and data center clients.

approach.summary: Rokad deployed an end-to-end BOM procurement and logistics engine, integrating deeply with engineering and operations to de-risk hardware supply.
steps: Conducted technical BOM deconstruction with engineering team to identify 120+ components and mitigate single-source risks.
Activated Rokad’s global supplier network in Shenzhen, Taipei, and California to secure allocation for scarce SoCs at competitive pricing.
Managed end-to-end import compliance, customs clearance, and bonded warehousing in India under DGFT/FEMA guidelines.
Implemented strategic buffer stock (8-week reserve) of critical ICs in Mumbai to ensure production continuity.
approach.timeline: Full solution deployed within 6 weeks of engagement.

results.summary: Enabled on-time commercial launch, secured enterprise contracts, and strengthened investor confidence through a resilient hardware supply chain.
metrics: Launched first commercial units 3 months ahead of original schedule.
Secured ₹8.5 Cr pilot contract with a top-5 Indian private bank.
Reduced average component lead time by 60% (22 → 9 weeks).
Supply chain de-risking contributed to successful Series B fundraising.

testimonial.quote: Rokad didn’t just source parts—they secured our go-to-market timeline. They became our hardware backbone.
testimonial.author: CTO, Client Company

title: Unlocking India’s Mid-Market with Data-Driven Pricing Strategy

client.name: Confidential – Global Automation SaaS Provider
client.description: A US-based B2B SaaS company offering no-code workflow automation, seeking to expand into the Indian market with a locally relevant pricing and packaging model.

challenge.summary: The client’s global pricing—based on per-user, per-month subscriptions—failed to resonate with Indian SMBs and mid-market firms, resulting in low conversion and stalled pipeline.
details: Initial India launch used US pricing (USD-equivalent), perceived as 3–5x too expensive by local buyers.
No segmentation by company size, industry, or digital maturity—leading to misaligned value perception.
Competitors (both global and local) offered usage-based, annual, or outcome-linked pricing models.
Lacked insights into willingness-to-pay (WTP) across Tier 1 vs. Tier 2/3 cities and key verticals (e.g., logistics, manufacturing, edtech).

approach.summary: Rokad conducted rapid market intelligence and co-designed a tiered, India-optimized pricing architecture aligned with local buying behavior and competitive dynamics.
steps: Executed 40+ interviews with target buyers (ops heads, founders, IT managers) across Mumbai, Bangalore, Pune, and Ahmedabad to map WTP and feature prioritization.
Analyzed 15+ competitor pricing pages, sales collateral, and channel strategies (including local players like Zycus and global entrants).
Designed a 3-tier pricing model: (1) Starter (annual, flat-fee for <50 employees), (2) Growth (usage-based + support SLA), (3) Enterprise (custom, outcome-linked).
Recommended bundling with local payment options (UPI, EMI) and annual billing discounts to improve cash flow alignment.
Integrated pricing into GTM playbook—training sales on value-based selling for each segment.
approach.timeline: Research to pricing launch completed in 5 weeks.

results.summary: Dramatically improved conversion, pipeline velocity, and market fit—positioning the client for scalable India growth.
metrics: Increased free-to-paid conversion rate by 2.8x within 3 months of pricing relaunch.
Reduced sales cycle by 34% due to clearer tiering and value alignment.
Secured 12 new mid-market clients (₹5–20 LAC ACV) in manufacturing and logistics verticals.
Achieved 92% customer satisfaction on pricing fairness (post-implementation survey).

testimonial.quote: Rokad didn’t just give us a price sheet—they gave us a market entry strategy rooted in how Indian businesses actually buy software.
testimonial.author: Head of International Growth, Client Company
